title: "Data tools"

The [NBDC Data Hub](https://nbdc-datahub.org) offers users two major applications to explore, query, and download data for the [ABCD](https://abcdstudy.org) and [HBCD](https://hbcdstudy.org) studies.

- [Data Exploration and Analysis Portal (DEAP)](https://nbdc.deapscience.com)
- [NBDC Data Access Platform](https://nbdc-datashare.lassoinformatics.com)

  While the applications can be used for similar tasks, they differ with regard to their user 
  interface and offer distinct features. The table below gives an overview of current features 
  as well as planned future directions of the two applicationsâ€”we encourage users to explore 
  both applications to see what best suits their needs.

::: {.callout-note title="Updates"}
- An in-situ coding environment for analyses is in the works. Stay tuned for more details.
- DEAP is currently developing in-platform data exploration & analysis modules to enable secure-web based use of the ABCD data. Learn more [here](https://docs.deapscience.com/).
::: 

::: {.callout-important title="Data dictionary vs. data acccess"}
- Users can explore the ABCD Study data dictionary via [DEAP's data dictionary & ontology browser](https://abcd.deapscience.com/#/my-datasets/create-dataset) or [the NBDC Data Access Platform Query Tool](https://nbdc-datashare.lassoinformatics.com) before obtaining a data use certification (DUC). To create custom datasets and download data, users need an active DUC (for more details, see [here](../usage/access.qmd)).
:::
